newsitem.title: USA: Major oils firm in thin volume, Exxon off.
newsitem.headline: Major oils firm in thin volume, Exxon off.

text.p: Most major oils were firm in thin volume, bucking a lower market trend, with the exception of Exxon Corp, which has been cut to market performer from outperform by analysts at Schroder Wertheim and Lehman Bros.

"I am not seeing any excessive volume; this appears to be just a sector which has been ignored by the market benefiting from some new money as investors switch," said Schroder Wertheim analyst Philip Tendler.
Schroder has overweighted major oils for some time.
By 1130 EDT/1530 GMT, Exxon, which mostly trades in line with other blue chips, was off 1/4 at 58-5/8 after having been cut on price.
Other oils were firmer. Atlantic Richfield Co added 1-5/8 to 145-5/8 after it announced that reserves at its Alpine field in Alaska were higher than originally forecast.
Anadarko Petroleum Corp, also a partner in the Alpine field, put on 1-1/4 to 58-7/8
Chevron Corp put on 3/8 to 69-7/8, Mobil Corp 7/8 to 132-5/8 and Texaco Inc 1/2 to 108-1/8.

Lehman Bros analyst William Randol said in a research report that investors would be better served by investing in Texaco, Mobil and Chevron rather than Exxon at current valuations. ((-- David Chance New York Newsroom 212 859 1902))
